config.script:
if not self.view.custom.popup_is_open:
        system.perspective.openPopup(
            "statusPopup",
            "Forecast/Popuptable",
            showCloseIcon=False,
            showTitle=False,
            overlayDismiss=False,
            position={"left": 400, "top": 140},
            width=250,    # match your view's width (from Designer)
            height=230    # match your view's height (from Designer)
            #anchor=self.getSibling("statusTriggerBox")  # Adjust path if needed!
        )
        self.view.custom.popup_is_open = True
        system.perspective.print("Popup opened. State: " + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))
    else:
        system.perspective.closePopup("statusPopup")
        self.view.custom.popup_is_open = False
        system.perspective.print("Popup closed. State: " + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))

"""
    Status bar onClick – toggles the status-picker popup
    Compatible with Ignition versions that don't have system.perspective.isPopupOpen
    """

    popup_id = "statusPopup"            # keep this stable

    # 1️⃣ Try to close it first (toggle behaviour)
    try:
        system.perspective.closePopup(popup_id)
        return                           # it was open → now closed → we're done
    except ValueError:
        # closePopup throws ValueError if popup_id wasn't found → means it's not open yet
        pass

    # 2️⃣ Open it, anchored to the whole bar (event.source)
    system.perspective.openPopup(
        popupId     = popup_id,
        view        = "StatusPicker/Popup",   # << adjust if your path differs
        target      = event.source,           # anchor to the bar you clicked
        anchor      = "southWest",            # directly below, left-aligned
        offsetY     = 4,                      # small gap
        modal       = False,
        draggable   = False,
        resizable   = False,
        shrinkToFit = True
    )

"""
	Click-to-toggle Status Picker popup
	Attach this to:  statusTriggerBox  (or iconCaret / rowContent – your choice)
	"""

	popup_id = "statusPopup"            # keep this ID stable

	# ── If it's already open, close it (toggle behaviour)
	if system.perspective.isPopupOpen(popup_id):
	    system.perspective.closePopup(popup_id)
	    return

	# ── Open it, anchored to the component that was clicked (event.source)
	system.perspective.openPopup(
	    popupId     = popup_id,
	    view        = "StatusPicker/Popup",   # <-- your popup view path
	    title       = "Pick statuses",
	    target      = event.source,           # anchor *this* component
	    anchor      = "southWest",            # just below, left-aligned
	    offsetX     = 0,                      # tweak gap if you like
	    offsetY     = 4,
	    modal       = False,
	    draggable   = False,
	    resizable   = False,
	    shrinkToFit = True                    # auto-size to content
	)

"""
    Attach this onClick to the caret icon, but anchor the popup to the parent row.
    """
    popup_id = "statusPopup"

    if system.perspective.isPopupOpen(popup_id):
        system.perspective.closePopup(popup_id)
        return

    # 'self.parent' is rowContent; use 'self.parent.parent' if you need statusTriggerBox
    system.perspective.openPopup(
        popupId     = popup_id,
        view        = "StatusPicker/Popup",
        title       = "Pick statuses",
        target      = self.parent,       # anchor to the *row*, not the tiny icon
        anchor      = "southWest",
        offsetY     = 4,
        modal       = False,
        draggable   = False,
        resizable   = False,
        shrinkToFit = True
    )

"""
    iconCaret.onClick – opens / closes the status picker

    • keeps toggle behaviour
    • anchors popup to the *row* so it starts under the bar, not out in space
    """

    popup_id = "statusPopup"           # stable ID

    # Toggle: close if it’s already open
    if system.perspective.isPopupOpen(popup_id):
        system.perspective.closePopup(popup_id)
        return

    # Anchor to the row (one or two levels up – adjust if needed)
    anchor_component = self.parent        # rowContent
    # If rowContent is still too small/narrow, use the full bar:
    # anchor_component = self.parent.parent   # statusTriggerBox

    system.perspective.openPopup(
        popupId     = popup_id,
        view        = "StatusPicker/Popup",   # path to your popup view
        title       = "Pick statuses",
        target      = anchor_component,
        anchor      = "southWest",            # directly under, left-aligned
        offsetY     = 4,                      # small vertical gap
        modal       = False,
        draggable   = False,
        resizable   = False,
        shrinkToFit = True
    )

popup_id = "statusPopup"            # stable id

    # Toggle behaviour: close if already open
    if system.perspective.isPopupOpen(popup_id):
        system.perspective.closePopup(popup_id)
        return

    system.perspective.openPopup(
        popupId     = popup_id,
        view        = "StatusPicker/Popup",   # path to your popup view
        title       = "Pick statuses",
        target = self.parent,  # rowContent  (or self.parent.parent for statusTriggerBox)
        anchor      = "southWest",            # popup under & left-aligned
        offsetY     = 4,                      # small vertical gap
        modal       = False,
        draggable   = False,
        resizable   = False,
        shrinkToFit = True
    )

system.perspective.print("1." + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))
	if not self.view.custom.popup_is_open:
		system.perspective.openPopup(
		"statusPopup",             # popupId
		"StatusPicker/Popup",      # folder/view path—must match your tree
		showCloseIcon=True,
		#modal=False,
		overlayDismiss=True,
		position = {"left": event.pageX, "top": event.pageY + 8},
		#hideOnOutsideClick = True
		)
		self.view.custom.popup_is_open = True
		system.perspective.print("2." + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))
	elif self.view.custom.popup_is_open:
		system.perspective.print("hernea")
		system.perspective.closePopup("statusPopup", "StatusPicker/Popup")
		system.perspective.print("3." + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))
		self.view.custom.popup_is_open = False
		system.perspective.print("4." + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))

if not self.view.custom.popup_is_open:
     system.perspective.openPopup(
        "statusPopup",
        "StatusPicker/Popup",
        showCloseIcon=True,
        overlayDismiss=True,
        #position={"left": event.pageX, "top": event.pageY + 8},
     )
     self.view.custom.popup_is_open = True
     system.perspective.print("Popup opened. State: " + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))
    else:
     system.perspective.closePopup("statusPopup")
     self.view.custom.popup_is_open = False
     system.perspective.print("Popup closed. State: " + str(self.view.custom.popup_is_open))
